data.title: Feature Request: Hotkey Trigger For IntelliSense Suggestions
data.body:
The usefulness of IntelliSense could be dramatically improved by including a number-based hot-key quick select for the first 9 elements.

[Alfred for Mac](https://www.alfredapp.com/) includes this feature, and I find it very useful.

With this addition, one could immediately select any of the top selections in the IntelliSense pop-up with a key shortcut such as `Control-1` for the first, or `Control-2` for the second. The modifier would be configurable for the user, and a sane default would need to be chosen to be shipped in VS Code. If we're getting into configuration, the entire feature could also be turned on and off by a setting.

A screenshot of the proposed behavior is attached to this issue.

![Hotkey Trigger For IntelliSense Suggestions Proposal Screenshot](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/742678/30246778-68b2f918-95b8-11e7-92e1-91aac2b9fa16.png)

data.title: [html][emmet] Emmet Backspace Issue
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode. -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version:1.16
- OS Version: OSX 10.12.6

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open and save an html file
2. Write "select[name=foo]>option[value=bar$]*2"
3. TAB it to autocomplete with emmet
4. Undo with STRG+Z
5. Delete the last 2 characters "*2"
6. TAB again
7. Nothing happens
8. Delete the last "]" then replace it with a freshly typed "]"
9. TAB again and it works again

It would be great if emmet is still recognized after deleting the code after an undo. Sometimes you have to adjust the emmet snippets and the issue described above is slightly annoying. Thanks!

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes/No

data.title: Cannot run certain npm scripts as preLaunchTask
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.17.0-insider (c354fca44896da2c9cad82b9bd9126f6658cfae8, 2017-09-08T05:24:34.310Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT x64 10.0.14393
- Extensions: none
---

**Description:**
Setting a `preLaunchTask` to common built-in scripts like "build", or arbitrary scripts like "foo", works as expected. However, setting it to uncommon built-in scripts like "pretest" fails.

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Launch the default "Mocha Tests" configuration with a `preLaunchTask` of `npm: pretest`.

**Expected:**
The task runner should execute `npm run pretest`.

**Actual:**
`Could not find the preLaunchTask 'npm: pretest'.`

---
**launch.json**
```
{
    "version": "0.2.0",
    "configurations": [
        {
            "type": "node",
            "request": "launch",
            "name": "Mocha Tests",
            "program": "${workspaceRoot}/node_modules/mocha/bin/_mocha",
            "args": [
                "-u",
                "tdd",
                "--timeout",
                "999999",
                "--colors",
                "${workspaceRoot}/test"
            ],
            "internalConsoleOptions": "openOnSessionStart",
            "preLaunchTask": "npm: pretest"
        }
    ]
}
```
**package.json**
```
{
    "name": "example",
    "version": "0.0.1",
    "devDependencies": {
        "mocha": "^3.5.0",
        "typescript": "^2.5.2"
    },
    "scripts": {
        "build": "echo build",
        "pretest": "echo pretest",
        "test": "echo test"
    }
}
```

**Workaround:**
- Create a "shell" task that executes `npm run <script>` and set the `preLaunchTask` to that.

data.title: ibus-gtk not working
data.body:
Hello. The problem I'm facing now is when I installed ibus-gtk, I cannot type Chinese characters or any other foreign language characters in VS Code. The purpose of ibus-gtk is to allow the candidate panel to appear as I type. Here are two screenshots of the problem.

![problem2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25891418/30241973-2aef5ca4-95c0-11e7-86c5-f7d493fae7dd.png)

As you can see from the first image, the candidate panel appears at the bottom of the screen. However, if I install ibus-gtk, I cannot type chinese characters in VS Code.

I don't know how to fill in the Steps to Reproduce. Sorry.

--The End--

data.title: vscode doesn't notice typechange on files
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode. -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.15.1
- OS Version: Ubuntu 16.04.3 LTS

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create symlink like `link -s libx--1.0.so.1 libx.so`
2. Commit the change
3. delete the symlink, replace it with a copy of the file (`rm libx.so && cp libx-1.0.so.1 libx.so`)

`git status` shows `typechange: libx.so`

while vscode shows no changes.

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes (shows no changes while git status does)

data.title: CSS syntax highlighting doesn't handle strings with line continuations correctly
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.16.0 (787b31c0474e6165390b5a5989c9619e3e16f953, 2017-09-06T16:12:42.401Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.7.0
- Extensions: Extensions are disabled
---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a CSS file containing a string that has a line continuation (backslash newline).

Expected Output:

The syntax highlighting shows the continued line as being a continuation of the string.

Actual Output:

The syntax highlighting treats the string as having ended at the line continuation and formats the continued line as if it was not part of the string.  This can be verified using the `Developer: Inspect TM Scopes` command.

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes

Here is a simple test case:

```
#testcase::before {
    content: 'long string\
    using line continuation';
}
```

Here is how Visual Studio Code syntax highlighting shows the test case:
![vscode](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7471464/30240372-9ad33af8-95b2-11e7-9921-2e4978d0925e.png)

For comparison here is how Atom (1.19.5) syntax highlighting correctly shows the test case:
![atom](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7471464/30240374-a6883f06-95b2-11e7-9a4d-7fc8f203ca55.png)

vscode-github|Kni|0.19.0
vue|liu|0.1.5
lit-it|moh|1.2.12
debugger-for-chrome|msj|3.2.1
vetur|oct|0.9.7
vuehelper|oys|0.1.0
vscode-docker|Pet|0.0.16
material-icon-theme|PKi|2.2.0
vscode-icons|rob|7.12.0
code-settings-sync|Sha|2.8.3
code-spell-checker|str|1.3.9
vscode-react-redux-snippets|tha|0.3.3
ReactSnippets|xab|1.4.0



---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Have 32 bits Windows version of VSCode installed
2. Upgrade it to the new 64 bits version

Reproduces without extensions: No

Hello,
I'm reporting this not expecting any fix, but to help other users with the same problem.
I had the 32 bit version of VSCode installed. I upgraded it to the 64 bits version expecting to loose all y configurations and extensions. To my surprise that was not the case, and all my extensions an configurations were kept 👍 
However, the first thing I noticed was the lack of syntax highlighting on VUE files. After toying a bit with Vetur extension I decided to uninstall - reload - install - reload. After that it started to work properly. The same thing happened with "Debugger for chrome": The extension was failing, so I uninstalled - reload- installed - reload and it started to work too.

I think it's worth mention this situation so people don't get mad about it.

Regards

data.title: Youtube Integration with VS Code
data.body: While learning lot of JavaScript libraries or frameworks, I use YouTube  coding tutorials. But opening YouTube in browser and working with tutorial in VS code is difficult. If VS code can have integrated youtube same as integrated terminal, it will be great help.

data.title: Option to keep documentContentProvider alive when tab is changed
data.body:
We have very bad feedback about VSCode + PIO Home (@platformio). PIO Home is React.JS based application which we load using `iframe`. It depends on a server backend and needs 1-2sec to be started.

See related issue with detailed description for this problem: https://github.com/platformio/platformio-vscode-ide/issues/32

I've already received a feedback from @Tyriar / @mjbvz that it's a normal behavior of VSCode.

We propose our extensions of PlatformIO IDE for Atom and VSCode. We don't have any problems with Atom, it allows us to decide what to do with an internal content provider.

------

So, how about to have an option for `vscode.workspace.registerTextDocumentContentProvider` where we can explain VSCode to don't kill our documentContentProvider when a tab is changed?

data.body: - VSCode Version: Code 1.15.1 (41abd21afdf7424c89319ee7cb0445cc6f376959, 2017-08-16T17:15:57.756Z) - OS Version: Darwin x64 16.7.0 - Extensions: Extension|Author (truncated)|Version ---|---|--- gc-excelviewer|Gra|1.1.15 output-colorizer|IBM|0.1.2 r|Iku|0.4.4 vscode-github|Kni|0.19.0 material-icon-theme|PKi|2.2.0 rmd|nac|0.0.1 tmlanguage|Tog|0.7.1 Bookmarks|ale|0.16.0 project-manager|ale|0.21.1 unique-lines|bib|1.0.0 npm-intellisense|chr|1.3.0 vscode-eslint|dba|1.2.11 python|don|0.7.0 vscode-npm-script|eg2|0.2.1 prettier-vscode|esb|0.23.1 wordcounter|kir|1.2.0 debugger-for-chrome|msj|3.2.1 nacho|nac|0.0.1 highlight-dodgy-characters|nac|0.3.1 run-external|nac|0.0.4 select-paragraph|nac|0.1.1 gremlins|nho|0.4.1 partial-diff|ryu|0.3.1 vscode-fileutils|sle|2.6.2 language-stylus|sys|1.7.3 vscode-input-sequence|tom|0.2.0 change-case|wma|1.0.0 vscode-open-in-github|ziy|1.2.7 (5 theme extensions excluded) --- Steps to Reproduce: 1. On macOS, move the mouse relatively quickly outside of the editor window. 2. 50% of the time, the cursor doesn't go back to its normal black arrow form, but rather stays in the white I-beam vertical bar shape. This makes it incredibly hard to see in a white background 3. If you move the mouse slowly out of the editor window, it always turns into a black arrow Cursor outside of vscode window turns into a black arrow 👍 : Cursor outside of vscode window remains as a white l-beam (really hard to see!) 👎: Is there a setting to prevent this behavior? Reproduces without extensions: Yes

data.title: Right-click option (in VSCode) for "Open folder in VSCode"
data.body:
In the sidebar, I would like to suggest the feature to be able to right click on a folder and click something along the lines of "Open folder in VSCode".
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/28223854/30239401-bdb90c5a-9553-11e7-8d6c-8f571e0fdc3a.png)
The right click menu in question is shown in the picture above, after having clicked that option VSCode will change to this:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/28223854/30239436-541da17e-9554-11e7-9f7f-3c029a5f52f3.png)
I may suggest also having two options, one for open in a new window, and one for open in current window.

data.title: Fix a small typo in snippet.md
data.body: The word `varibale` is misspelt. It should be `variable`.

Steps to Reproduce:

1. put some "textMateRules" in "editor.tokenColorCustomizations" in USER SETTINGS
2. toggle "Developer: Inspect TM Scopes" on
You will see a small pop up window with "Loading..." in it, and that's it.

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes

data.title: Custom Titlebar Should Not Be Focusable
data.body: It is uncomfortable that we have to click on the editor to be able to type every time we drag the custom titlebar. A titlebar should have been non-focusable without doubt.

data.title: Performing one off actions on extension update and memento/storage persistence
data.body: I have some extension specific data is stored in `storagePath` and mementos. Is this data persisted across extension updates? If I want to perform a one off action when an extension is updated is the solution to store a version number in a memento?

data.title: Open Folder fails if no files in said folder
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.15.1 (41abd21afdf7424c89319ee7cb0445cc6f376959, 2017-08-16T18:07:25.676Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT x64 10.0.15063
- Extensions: 

Extension|Author (truncated)|Version
---|---|---
python|don|0.7.0
cpptools|ms-|0.12.3
code-spell-checker|str|1.3.9



---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. File -> Open Folder. Select a folder with no files, only sub-folders.
2. Selected folder will not open and you end up at the Welcome screen.

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Did not test, but should.

data.title: [i18n] Curly quotes
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.16.0
- OS Version: macOS Sierra

Currently, all localized strings in French locale uses straight quotes (`'`):

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8125011/30237082-dffab162-94f7-11e7-8e33-8ec468fee895.png)

while in most macOS apps, the curly quote `’` is used correctly:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8125011/30237108-cf97052c-94f8-11e7-9673-c9ab6e899f1b.png)

Due to the widespread usage of quotation mark in the French language, this has been bugging me for a while.
